title: Australia research: COVID-19 Vaccine Side Effects Mostly Affect White People of European descent
cleaned_text:
Blood clots as a side effect of corona vaccine especially affect people of European descent, who carry a particular gene variant. It shows research now, reports Medical Xpress.

In the new study, researchers in Australia have investigated why some people who take coronavina vaccine suffer from the life-threatening condition thrombotic thrombocytope purpura (TTP), which is caused by blood clots.

In early 2021, TTP was linked to AstraZeneca’s corona vaccine, which led several countries to stop using the vaccine for certain groups. The vaccine from Johnson & Johnson can also cause TTP as a side effect.

The researchers examined five patients who suffered from the life-threatening side effect and found that all carried a specific gene variant, called IGLV3-21 * 02, which occurs mainly in people of European descent.

According to the researchers, it seems to be the gene variant in combination with the presence of unusual antibodies to a protein called PF4 that causes the life-threatening side effect.

The findings may make it possible to create a genetic screening tool to identify patients at risk for vaccination complications, the researchers write.

It also provides a unique opportunity for a targeted, specific therapy development that aims to neutralize this very harmful but very specific antibody, says researcher Jing Jing Wang.

It is amazing that a Chinese researcher (Jing Jing Wang) is more interested in the well-being of white people than white people are of themselves.
